content: The main website https://teorth.github.io/equational_theories/ is a copy of README.md, but the local links that work for README.md often do not work at the website location (in particular, the image link is broken). We could fix this by replacing all local links at README.md with global links - or is there a better solution?
Replacing them with the full link is the better option for now.

The markdown files are compiled by a tool called Jekyll. All relative links are likely to be assumed as relative to the website's base URL which differs from the repository's URL (basically that's the default html behaviour).

The blueprint tool could in principle preprocess the relative links and identify the ones that don't point to anything on the webpage, based on its knowledge of which links will be on the webpage. But this is very hard in practice, especially since we are customising the website beyond what the blueprint tool usually does. Further even if someone wants to take up this task, it has to happen upstream.
Terence Tao has marked this topic as resolved.
